elements.desc:
Material design: [Meaningful transitions](https://www.google.com/design/spec/animation/meaningful-transitions.html)

`neon-animated-pages` manages a set of pages and runs an animation when switching between them. Its
children pages should implement `Polymer.NeonAnimatableBehavior` and define `entry` and `exit`
animations to be run when switching to or switching out of the page.

events.desc:
Fired when iron-selector is activated (selected or deselected).
It is fired before the selected items are changed.
Cancel the event to abort selection.

jsdoc.description:
Fired when iron-selector is activated (selected or deselected).
It is fired before the selected items are changed.
Cancel the event to abort selection.
jsdoc.orig:
*
       * Fired when iron-selector is activated (selected or deselected).
       * It is fired before the selected items are changed.
       * Cancel the event to abort selection.
       *
       * @event iron-activate

events.name: iron-activate

events.desc: Fired when an item is deselected

jsdoc.description: Fired when an item is deselected
jsdoc.orig:
*
       * Fired when an item is deselected
       *
       * @event iron-deselect

events.name: iron-deselect

events.desc:
Fired when the list of selectable items changes (e.g., items are
added or removed). The detail of the event is a mutation record that
describes what changed.

jsdoc.description:
Fired when the list of selectable items changes (e.g., items are
added or removed). The detail of the event is a mutation record that
describes what changed.
jsdoc.orig:
*
       * Fired when the list of selectable items changes (e.g., items are
       * added or removed). The detail of the event is a mutation record that
       * describes what changed.
       *
       * @event iron-items-changed

events.name: iron-items-changed

events.desc: Fired when an item is selected

jsdoc.description: Fired when an item is selected
jsdoc.orig:
*
       * Fired when an item is selected
       *
       * @event iron-select

events.name: iron-select

properties.name: animateInitialSelection
properties.desc: if true, the initial page selection will also be animated according to its animation config.

properties.name: animationConfig
properties.desc: Animation configuration. See README for more info.

properties.name: assignParentResizable
properties.desc:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

properties.name: attrForSelected
properties.desc:
If you want to use an attribute value or property of an element for
`selected` instead of the index, set this to the name of the attribute
or property. Hyphenated values are converted to camel case when used to
look up the property of a selectable element. Camel cased values are
*not* converted to hyphenated values for attribute lookup. It's
recommended that you provide the hyphenated form of the name so that
selection works in both cases. (Use `attr-or-property-name` instead of
`attrOrPropertyName`.)

properties.name: cancelAnimation
properties.desc: Cancels the currently running animations.

properties.name: entryAnimation
properties.desc:
Convenience property for setting an 'entry' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.entry`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

properties.name: exitAnimation
properties.desc:
Convenience property for setting an 'exit' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.exit`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

properties.name: fallbackSelection
properties.desc:
Default fallback if the selection based on selected with `attrForSelected`
is not found.

properties.name: forceSynchronousItemUpdate
properties.desc:
Force a synchronous update of the `items` property.

NOTE: Consider listening for the `iron-items-changed` event to respond to
updates to the set of selectable items after updates to the DOM list and
selection state have been made.

WARNING: If you are using this method, you should probably consider an
alternate approach. Synchronously querying for items is potentially
slow for many use cases. The `items` property will update asynchronously
on its own to reflect selectable items in the DOM.

properties.name: getAnimationConfig
properties.desc:
An element implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimationRunnerBehavior` calls this method to configure
an animation with an optional type. Elements implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimatableBehavior`
should define the property `animationConfig`, which is either a configuration object
or a map of animation type to array of configuration objects.

properties.name: indexOf
properties.desc: Returns the index of the given item.

tags.description: Returns the index of the item

properties.name: items
properties.desc: The list of items from which a selection can be made.

properties.name: notifyResize
properties.desc:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

properties.name: playAnimation
properties.desc: Plays an animation with an optional `type`.

properties.name: resizerShouldNotify
properties.desc:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.desc:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

properties.name: select
properties.desc: Selects the given value.

properties.name: selectable
properties.desc:
This is a CSS selector string.  If this is set, only items that match the CSS selector
are selectable.

properties.name: selected
properties.desc: Gets or sets the selected element. The default is to use the index of the item.

properties.name: selectedAttribute
properties.desc: The attribute to set on elements when selected.

properties.name: selectedClass
properties.desc: The class to set on elements when selected.

properties.name: selectedItem
properties.desc: Returns the currently selected item.

properties.name: selectIndex
properties.desc: Selects the item at the given index.

properties.name: selectNext
properties.desc: Selects the next item.

properties.name: selectPrevious
properties.desc: Selects the previous item.

properties.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
properties.desc:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

properties.name: _completeSelectedChanged
_excludedLocalNames
properties.desc:
The set of excluded elements where the key is the `localName`
of the element that will be ignored from the item list.

properties.name: _notifyingDescendant
properties.desc:
True if this element is currently notifying its descedant elements of
resize.

properties.name: _observeItems
properties.desc: observe items change under the given node.

properties.name: _parentResizable
properties.desc: The closest ancestor element that implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

elements.desc:
`<neon-animatable>` is a simple container element implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimatableBehavior`. This is a convenience element for use with `<neon-animated-pages>`.

```
<neon-animated-pages selected="0"
                     entry-animation="slide-from-right-animation"
                     exit-animation="slide-left-animation">
  <neon-animatable>1</neon-animatable>
  <neon-animatable>2</neon-animatable>
</neon-animated-pages>
```

properties.name: animationConfig
properties.desc: Animation configuration. See README for more info.

properties.name: assignParentResizable
properties.desc:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

properties.desc:
Convenience property for setting an 'entry' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.entry`

properties.name: exitAnimation
properties.desc:
Convenience property for setting an 'exit' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.exit`

params.name: element

True if this element is currently notifying its descedant elements of

properties.desc: The closest ancestor element that implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

elements.desc:
`<cascaded-animation>` applies an animation on an array of elements with a delay between each.
the delay defaults to 50ms.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'cascaded-animation',
  animation: <animation-name>,
  nodes: <array-of-nodes>,
  nodeDelay: <node-delay-in-ms>,
  timing: <animation-timing>
}
```

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: isNeonAnimation
properties.desc: Can be used to determine that elements implement this behavior.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

properties.name: configure

elements.desc:
`<fade-out-animation>` animates the opacity of an element from 1 to 0.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'fade-out-animation',
  node: <node>
  timing: <animation-timing>
}
```

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: complete
properties.desc: Called when the animation finishes.

properties.name: isNeonAnimation
properties.desc: Can be used to determine that elements implement this behavior.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

elements.desc:
`<fade-in-animation>` animates the opacity of an element from 0 to 1.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'fade-in-animation',
  node: <node>
  timing: <animation-timing>
}
```

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: complete
properties.desc: Called when the animation finishes.

properties.name: isNeonAnimation
properties.desc: Can be used to determine that elements implement this behavior.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

elements.desc:
`<hero-animation>` is a shared element animation that scales and transform an element such that it
appears to be shared between two pages. Use this in `<neon-animated-pages>`. The source page
should use this animation in an 'exit' animation and set the `fromPage` configuration property to
itself, and the destination page should use this animation in an `entry` animation and set the
`toPage` configuration property to itself. They should also define the hero elements in the
`sharedElements` property (not a configuration property, see
`Polymer.NeonSharedElementAnimatableBehavior`).

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'hero-animation',
  id: <shared-element-id>,
  timing: <animation-timing>,
  toPage: <node>, /* define for the destination page */
  fromPage: <node>, /* define for the source page */
}
```

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: findSharedElements
properties.desc: Finds shared elements based on `config`.

properties.name: isNeonAnimation
properties.desc: Can be used to determine that elements implement this behavior.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: sharedElements
properties.desc: Cached copy of shared elements.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

elements.desc:
`<opaque-animation>` makes an element `opacity:1` for the duration of the animation. Used to prevent
webkit/safari from drawing a frame before an animation for elements that animate from display:none.

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: isNeonAnimation
properties.desc: Can be used to determine that elements implement this behavior.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

elements.desc:
`<ripple-animation>` scales and transform an element such that it appears to ripple from either
a shared element, or from a screen position, to full screen.

If using as a shared element animation in `<neon-animated-pages>`, use this animation in an `exit`
animation in the source page and in an `entry` animation in the destination page. Also, define the
hero elements in the `sharedElements` property (not a configuration property, see
`Polymer.NeonSharedElementAnimatableBehavior`).

If using a screen position, define the `gesture` property.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'ripple-animation`.
  id: <shared-element-id>, /* set this or gesture */
  gesture: {x: <page-x>, y: <page-y>}, /* set this or id */
  timing: <animation-timing>,
  toPage: <node>, /* define for the destination page */
  fromPage: <node>, /* define for the source page */
}
```

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: findSharedElements
properties.desc: Finds shared elements based on `config`.

properties.name: isNeonAnimation
properties.desc: Can be used to determine that elements implement this behavior.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: sharedElements
properties.desc: Cached copy of shared elements.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

elements.desc:
`<reverse-ripple-animation>` scales and transform an element such that it appears to ripple down from this element, to either
a shared element, or a screen position.

If using as a shared element animation in `<neon-animated-pages>`, use this animation in an `exit`
animation in the source page and in an `entry` animation in the destination page. Also, define the
reverse-ripple elements in the `sharedElements` property (not a configuration property, see
`Polymer.NeonSharedElementAnimatableBehavior`).
If using a screen position, define the `gesture` property.
Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'reverse-ripple-animation`.
  id: <shared-element-id>, /* set this or gesture */
  gesture: {x: <page-x>, y: <page-y>}, /* set this or id */
  timing: <animation-timing>,
  toPage: <node>, /* define for the destination page */
  fromPage: <node>, /* define for the source page */
}
```

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: findSharedElements
properties.desc: Finds shared elements based on `config`.

properties.name: isNeonAnimation
properties.desc: Can be used to determine that elements implement this behavior.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: sharedElements

Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined

elements.desc:
`<scale-down-animation>` animates the scale transform of an element from 1 to 0. By default it
scales in both the x and y axes.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'scale-down-animation',
  node: <node>,
  axis: 'x' | 'y' | '',
  transformOrigin: <transform-origin>,
  timing: <animation-timing>
}
```

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: complete
properties.desc: Called when the animation finishes.

properties.name: isNeonAnimation
properties.desc: Can be used to determine that elements implement this behavior.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

elements.desc:
`<scale-up-animation>` animates the scale transform of an element from 0 to 1. By default it
scales in both the x and y axes.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'scale-up-animation',
  node: <node>,
  axis: 'x' | 'y' | '',
  transformOrigin: <transform-origin>,
  timing: <animation-timing>
}
```

elements.desc:
`<slide-from-right-animation>` animates the transform of an element from
`translateX(100%)` to `none`.
The `transformOrigin` defaults to `0 50%`.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'slide-from-right-animation',
  node: <node>,
  transformOrigin: <transform-origin>,
  timing: <animation-timing>
}
```

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: complete

properties.name: isNeonAnimation

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty

properties.name: timingFromConfig

  node: <node>,
  transformOrigin: <transform-origin>,

elements.desc:
`<transform-animation>` animates a custom transform on an element. Use this to animate multiple
transform properties, or to apply a custom transform value.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'transform-animation',
  node: <node>,
  transformOrigin: <transform-origin>,
  transformFrom: <transform-from-string>,
  transformTo: <transform-to-string>,
  timing: <animation-timing>
}
```

an animation with an optional type. Elements implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimatableBehavior`
should define the property `animationConfig`, which is either a configuration object
or a map of animation type to array of configuration objects.

neon-animated-pages.desc:
Material design: [Meaningful transitions](https://www.google.com/design/spec/animation/meaningful-transitions.html)

`neon-animated-pages` manages a set of pages and runs an animation when switching between them. Its
children pages should implement `Polymer.NeonAnimatableBehavior` and define `entry` and `exit`
animations to be run when switching to or switching out of the page.

events.desc:
Fired when iron-selector is activated (selected or deselected).
It is fired before the selected items are changed.
Cancel the event to abort selection.

jsdoc.description:
Fired when iron-selector is activated (selected or deselected).
It is fired before the selected items are changed.
Cancel the event to abort selection.
jsdoc.orig:
*
       * Fired when iron-selector is activated (selected or deselected).
       * It is fired before the selected items are changed.
       * Cancel the event to abort selection.
       *
       * @event iron-activate

added or removed). The detail of the event is a mutation record that
describes what changed.

properties.name: animateInitialSelection
properties.desc: if true, the initial page selection will also be animated according to its animation config.

properties.name: animationConfig
properties.desc: Animation configuration. See README for more info.

properties.name: assignParentResizable
properties.desc:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

properties.name: attrForSelected
properties.desc:
If you want to use an attribute value or property of an element for
`selected` instead of the index, set this to the name of the attribute
or property. Hyphenated values are converted to camel case when used to
look up the property of a selectable element. Camel cased values are
*not* converted to hyphenated values for attribute lookup. It's
recommended that you provide the hyphenated form of the name so that
selection works in both cases. (Use `attr-or-property-name` instead of
`attrOrPropertyName`.)

properties.name: cancelAnimation
properties.desc: Cancels the currently running animations.

properties.name: entryAnimation
properties.desc:
Convenience property for setting an 'entry' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.entry`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

properties.name: exitAnimation
properties.desc:
Convenience property for setting an 'exit' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.exit`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

properties.name: fallbackSelection
properties.desc:
Default fallback if the selection based on selected with `attrForSelected`
is not found.

properties.name: forceSynchronousItemUpdate
properties.desc:
Force a synchronous update of the `items` property.

NOTE: Consider listening for the `iron-items-changed` event to respond to
updates to the set of selectable items after updates to the DOM list and
selection state have been made.

WARNING: If you are using this method, you should probably consider an
alternate approach. Synchronously querying for items is potentially
slow for many use cases. The `items` property will update asynchronously
on its own to reflect selectable items in the DOM.

properties.desc:
An element implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimationRunnerBehavior` calls this method to configure
an animation with an optional type. Elements implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimatableBehavior`
should define the property `animationConfig`, which is either a configuration object
or a map of animation type to array of configuration objects.

properties.name: indexOf
properties.desc: Returns the index of the given item.

tags.description: Returns the index of the item

properties.name: items
properties.desc: The list of items from which a selection can be made.

properties.name: notifyResize
properties.desc:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

properties.name: playAnimation
properties.desc: Plays an animation with an optional `type`.

properties.name: resizerShouldNotify
properties.desc:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

params.name: element
params.desc:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

return.desc: True if the `element` should be notified of resize.

properties.name: select
properties.desc: Selects the given value.

properties.name: selectable
properties.desc:
This is a CSS selector string.  If this is set, only items that match the CSS selector
are selectable.

properties.name: selected
properties.desc: Gets or sets the selected element. The default is to use the index of the item.

properties.name: selectedAttribute
properties.desc: The attribute to set on elements when selected.

properties.name: selectedClass
properties.desc: The class to set on elements when selected.

properties.name: selectedItem
properties.desc: Returns the currently selected item.

properties.name: selectIndex
properties.desc: Selects the item at the given index.

properties.name: selectNext
properties.desc: Selects the next item.

properties.name: selectPrevious
properties.desc: Selects the previous item.

properties.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
properties.desc:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

properties.name: _completeSelectedChanged
_excludedLocalNames
properties.desc:
The set of excluded elements where the key is the `localName`
of the element that will be ignored from the item list.

properties.name: _notifyingDescendant
properties.desc:
True if this element is currently notifying its descedant elements of
resize.

properties.name: _observeItems
properties.desc: observe items change under the given node.

properties.name: _parentResizable
properties.desc: The closest ancestor element that implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

neon-animatable.desc:
`<neon-animatable>` is a simple container element implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimatableBehavior`. This is a convenience element for use with `<neon-animated-pages>`.

```
<neon-animated-pages selected="0"
                     entry-animation="slide-from-right-animation"
                     exit-animation="slide-left-animation">
  <neon-animatable>1</neon-animatable>
  <neon-animatable>2</neon-animatable>
</neon-animated-pages>
```

properties.name: animationConfig
properties.desc: Animation configuration. See README for more info.

properties.desc:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

Convenience property for setting an 'entry' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.entry`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

properties.name: exitAnimation
properties.desc:
Convenience property for setting an 'exit' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.exit`

cascaded-animation.desc:
`<cascaded-animation>` applies an animation on an array of elements with a delay between each.
the delay defaults to 50ms.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'cascaded-animation',
  animation: <animation-name>,
  nodes: <array-of-nodes>,
  nodeDelay: <node-delay-in-ms>,
  timing: <animation-timing>
}
```

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: isNeonAnimation
properties.desc: Can be used to determine that elements implement this behavior.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

properties.name: configure

fade-out-animation.desc:
`<fade-out-animation>` animates the opacity of an element from 1 to 0.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'fade-out-animation',
  node: <node>
  timing: <animation-timing>
}
```

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: complete
properties.desc: Called when the animation finishes.

properties.name: isNeonAnimation
properties.desc: Can be used to determine that elements implement this behavior.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

fade-in-animation.desc:
`<fade-in-animation>` animates the opacity of an element from 0 to 1.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'fade-in-animation',
  node: <node>
  timing: <animation-timing>
}
```

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

hero-animation.desc:
`<hero-animation>` is a shared element animation that scales and transform an element such that it
appears to be shared between two pages. Use this in `<neon-animated-pages>`. The source page
should use this animation in an 'exit' animation and set the `fromPage` configuration property to
itself, and the destination page should use this animation in an `entry` animation and set the
`toPage` configuration property to itself. They should also define the hero elements in the
`sharedElements` property (not a configuration property, see
`Polymer.NeonSharedElementAnimatableBehavior`).

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'hero-animation',
  id: <shared-element-id>,
  timing: <animation-timing>,
  toPage: <node>, /* define for the destination page */
  fromPage: <node>, /* define for the source page */
}
```

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: findSharedElements

properties.name: isNeonAnimation
properties.desc: Can be used to determine that elements implement this behavior.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: sharedElements
properties.desc: Cached copy of shared elements.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

opaque-animation.desc:
`<opaque-animation>` makes an element `opacity:1` for the duration of the animation. Used to prevent
webkit/safari from drawing a frame before an animation for elements that animate from display:none.

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: isNeonAnimation
properties.desc: Can be used to determine that elements implement this behavior.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

ripple-animation.desc:
`<ripple-animation>` scales and transform an element such that it appears to ripple from either
a shared element, or from a screen position, to full screen.

If using as a shared element animation in `<neon-animated-pages>`, use this animation in an `exit`
animation in the source page and in an `entry` animation in the destination page. Also, define the
hero elements in the `sharedElements` property (not a configuration property, see
`Polymer.NeonSharedElementAnimatableBehavior`).

If using a screen position, define the `gesture` property.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'ripple-animation`.
  id: <shared-element-id>, /* set this or gesture */
  gesture: {x: <page-x>, y: <page-y>}, /* set this or id */
  timing: <animation-timing>,
  toPage: <node>, /* define for the destination page */
  fromPage: <node>, /* define for the source page */
}
```

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: findSharedElements
properties.desc: Finds shared elements based on `config`.

properties.name: isNeonAnimation
properties.desc: Can be used to determine that elements implement this behavior.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: sharedElements
properties.desc: Cached copy of shared elements.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

reverse-ripple-animation.desc:
`<reverse-ripple-animation>` scales and transform an element such that it appears to ripple down from this element, to either
a shared element, or a screen position.

If using as a shared element animation in `<neon-animated-pages>`, use this animation in an `exit`
animation in the source page and in an `entry` animation in the destination page. Also, define the
reverse-ripple elements in the `sharedElements` property (not a configuration property, see
`Polymer.NeonSharedElementAnimatableBehavior`).
If using a screen position, define the `gesture` property.
Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'reverse-ripple-animation`.
  id: <shared-element-id>, /* set this or gesture */
  gesture: {x: <page-x>, y: <page-y>}, /* set this or id */
  timing: <animation-timing>,
  toPage: <node>, /* define for the destination page */
  fromPage: <node>, /* define for the source page */
}
```

by the animation.

scale-down-animation.desc:
`<scale-down-animation>` animates the scale transform of an element from 1 to 0. By default it
scales in both the x and y axes.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'scale-down-animation',
  node: <node>,
  axis: 'x' | 'y' | '',
  transformOrigin: <transform-origin>,
  timing: <animation-timing>
}
```

properties.name: animationTiming
properties.desc: Defines the animation timing.

properties.name: complete
properties.desc: Called when the animation finishes.

properties.name: isNeonAnimation
properties.desc: Can be used to determine that elements implement this behavior.

properties.name: setPrefixedProperty
properties.desc: Sets `transform` and `transformOrigin` properties along with the prefixed versions.

properties.name: timingFromConfig
properties.desc:
Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.

scale-up-animation.desc:
`<scale-up-animation>` animates the scale transform of an element from 0 to 1. By default it
scales in both the x and y axes.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'scale-up-animation',
  node: <node>,
  axis: 'x' | 'y' | '',
  transformOrigin: <transform-origin>,
  timing: <animation-timing>
}
```

slide-from-right-animation.desc:
`<slide-from-right-animation>` animates the transform of an element from
`translateX(100%)` to `none`.
The `transformOrigin` defaults to `0 50%`.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'slide-from-right-animation',
  node: <node>,
  transformOrigin: <transform-origin>,
  timing: <animation-timing>
}
```

transform-animation.desc:
`<transform-animation>` animates a custom transform on an element. Use this to animate multiple
transform properties, or to apply a custom transform value.

Configuration:
```
{
  name: 'transform-animation',
  node: <node>,
  transformOrigin: <transform-origin>,
  transformFrom: <transform-from-string>,
  transformTo: <transform-to-string>,
  timing: <animation-timing>
}
```

Returns the animation timing by mixing in properties from `config` to the defaults defined
by the animation.
